title: 17-year-old Rover 45 sells for less than price of a pint | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share They wanted to find a fully working vehicle that could be driven away the same day. Eventually they saw the silver Rover 45 1.4 hatchback - registered in 2000 - on eBay and put in the minimum bid - with no one willing to top it. It means the vehicle is cheaper than the average price of a pint in London - £3.90 (file picture) The auction was above board and open to everyone, said the researchers, and the car they bought was in a reasonable condition and 'tidy'. HonestJohn.co.uk director Daniel Harrison said the purchase proves Britain has one of the cheapest second hand car markets in Europe. He said: 'We think this may be the cheapest used car in Britain and while buying it may have been initially for a bit of fun, there are a couple of serious points to take from this. 'First, that the UK has some of the cheapest - if not the cheapest - used cars in Europe, meaning that you can run a half-decent car even if you're on a tight budget. 'And secondly, our consumerist society leads to massive depreciation, or otherwise perfectly usable cars being prematurely scrapped. 'There are few other places in the world where you could find a fully functional used car this cheaply, but the very fact that we did it proves that it's entirely possible. It means the car is also cheaper than a Big Mac Meal, pictured, which costs £4.29 The Rover is cheaper than everyday products such as £5 Head & Shoulders shampoo, left, or a tube of £3.50 Sensodyne toothpaste, right The car is even cheaper than the price of this screen wash, pictured, which costs £4.68 Share or comment on this article 107
